item.title: When defaults cannot be hedged: an actuarial approach to {xVA} calculations via local risk-minimization
item.description: arXiv:2502.12774v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We consider the pricing and hedging of counterparty credit risk and funding when there is no possibility to hedge the jump to default of either the bank or the counterparty. This represents the situation which is most often encountered in practice, due to the absence of quoted corporate bonds or CDS contracts written on the counterparty and the difficulty for the bank to buy/sell protection on her own default. We apply local risk-minimization to find the optimal strategy and compute it via a BSDE.
item.dc:creator: Francesca Biagini, Alessandro Gnoatto, Katharina Oberpriller
